CAN Community Health, one of the nationâs largest providers of HIV Services, has an exciting opportunity for a part-time Dentist to be part of our Mobil Medical Unit in Jacksonville, FL.  


We are looking for someone who is passionate about serving the needs of individuals impacted by HIV and other infectious diseases. We have received recognition in 2023, 2022, 2021, 2019, andamp; 2018 NPTand#39;s Best Non-Profit to Work for Award.


CAN is a Drug-Free Workplace. All potential hires will be required to take and clear a pre-employment drug screen upon job offer. 


Starting Salary $100/hour to $115/hour (based upon education level, background, and experience). 


You can find out more about us by visiting our website at www.cancommunityhealth.org. Apply Today!



Statement of Purpose:

As a Dentist with CAN Community Health, Inc., you are responsible for providing sensitive, quality health care and related services targeted to patients requiring treatment for HIV/AIDS, Hepatitis C, and Sexually Transmitted Diseases. The Dentist will support the organizationâs goal in providing care to straight, lesbian, gay, bisexual, and transgender communities in all their diversity regardless of their immediate ability to pay. The Dentist is responsible for screening, diagnoses and treatment of patients and providing care in a sensitive and non-judgmental manner. The Dentist will make appropriate internal and external referrals and is expected to maintain a high degree of professional competence and behavior while adhering to the highest possible ethical standards.

Collaborates and communicates with clinical and non-clinical staff in a professional manner.

Supports efforts to ensure that policies and procedures are appropriate to programs and services and that they are developed and/or adjusted according to programmatic changes and evolving community needs.

description:
Position: Clinical Director, Rutherford County (Murfreesboro, TN)

Who we are

Interfaith Dental is a volunteer-driven nonprofit agency that helps vulnerable populations achieve and sustain a healthy smile. Interfaith Dentalâs mission is to create a healthier community by providing transformational oral health care for those experiencing poverty.
Interfaith Dental now serves vulnerable populations in two clinic locations within a ten-county region of Middle Tennessee. Interfaith Dental focuses on life transformation through dentistry offering both access to oral health services as well as education, motivation, and inspiration.
The role you will play
The Clinical Director reports directly to the Chief Program Officer. The Clinical Director is to uphold the mission of Interfaith Dental and provide quality dental care that leads to successful and transformational patient outcomes. The Clinical Director is to be a leader amongst the clinical team including residents, volunteers, and students and providing mentorship as needed. 

Duties/Responsibilities:

â¢	Provide direct high quality patient care focusing on restoring patientâs ability to chew, smile, and be disease free.  Helping to capture stories where applicable.
â¢	Review clinical schedules team, volunteers and resident(s) for the day and coming week and work closely with front office team to adjust as needed to maximize capacity and patient experience. 
â¢	Responsible for direct oversight and development of enhanced clinical skills and didactic understanding for the AEGD resident(s) along with review of clinical notes and evaluations. 
â¢	Responsible for direct oversight and development of enhanced clinical skills for the Vanderbilt OS residents during their rotation at Interfaith Dental. 
Administrative andamp; Leadership:
â¢	Weekly meeting with Chief Program Officer
â¢	Oversee the Rutherford County office clinical staff, and daily operations. 
â¢	Participate in annual performance review for designated clinical team andamp; help clinical team to achieve their goals. 
â¢	Participation andamp; collaboration on leadership team andamp; aid in progress and completion of strategic plan as indicated. 
â¢	Represent and promote Interfaith Dental at fundraising events, study clubs, etc. 

What you will bring:

â¢	A graduate of an accredited dental school with active TN dental license.
â¢	Minimum of 1 year experience or completion of AEGD/GPR training.
â¢	Detail Oriented with effective organization skills. 
â¢	Team player that will support collaborative environment and a continuous improvement culture. 
â¢	Experience in leading and coaching a team.
â¢	Successful in working in fast-paced environment with a desire to expand both clinically and administratively. 

Are you someone who:

â¢	Has awesome leadership skills.
â¢	Is passionate about serving others.
â¢	Has excellent communication skills.
â¢	Can demonstrate a high degree of empathy and compassion.
â¢	Has an outgoing, friendly attitude with patients and staff even under pressure.
â¢	Able to recognize, evaluate and solve problems.
â¢	Is skilled at multi-tasking, organizational skills, and superb attention to detail.
â¢	Is proficient with standard office software applications (Microsoft Office, Dentrix)

If this sounds like you, then we want to hear from you!

Why Interfaith Dental?

Our greatest assets are our employees, and we are committed to their personal and professional development.  We provide education, flexibility, and a Culture Warrior program that contributes to our employeeâs high engagement and happiness, as well as the opportunity for a more complete and satisfying work-life integration.

Our Benefits

At the Interfaith Dental, we have competitive wages and a comprehensive benefits package that includes health, dental, work-life balance, generous paid sick time, paid parental leave, plus an employee assistance program (EAP) - to name a few. We also offer a 401k matching program. Not only do we have 6 paid holidays, but we also have a âCRESTâ day off â with pay! On top of that, we offer continuous learning and development and Who wouldnât want all of that?

description:
Excellent opportunity for an Endodontist to be a part of a well-established 
Endodontic practice in Northern New Jersey (Hackensack )  as a 
full-time OR part-time associate. New Endodontists are busy from day 1 because 
of the established referral base and processes already in place. We are 
currently seeking Endodontists that appreciate the professional, financial and 
administrative benefits of group practice to join our teams. 

Our offices are well designed, spacious, featuring all digital radiography, 
microscopes, and rotary endo. All of the required equipment and disposables are 
supplied by the office. Office management is highly trained and skilled. We 
have an excellent and well established regional referral base with room to grow.

_________________________________________

â¢Examine, diagnose, and treat diseases of nerve, pulp, and other dental tissues 
affecting  vitality of teeth

â¢Courteous with staff and patients

______________________________________________________________________________

About Us

As an office committed to excellence, at Advanced Endodontics Alliance we take 
pride in the fact that we are equipped with instruments and techniques which 
exhibit the latest and greatest endodontic technology available. We strive to 
provide the best possible endodontic care, stay informed of the latest 
techniques and products, provide a safe and environmentally healthy workplace, 
work with our patients regarding their unique concerns, and give back to the 
community.

Our experienced, caring, and supportive team will make your transition seamless! Please email resume and we look forward to discussing this opportunity further.

description:
Join our team as a Dentist at Cottage Grove Dental Care and take your career to the next level! Become an established dentist at a thriving practice. Take advantage of our dedicated mentorship and our CE program. Grow with us!
Why you should join:
* $20,000 signing bonus paid within your first 30 days of employment
* $10,000/month guaranteed income for your first 3 months
* Paid CE up to $5,000 annually
* Work 4 days per week
* 100% clinical autonomy
* Doctor mentorship
*Learn on the job with full support
* License renewal reimbursement
* Exclusive option to purchase shares of a growing and prosperous company
* Work in an environment where the end goal is quality patient care and creating a fun and healthy office culture
* Competitive benefits including an employer matched Simple IRA, monthly health insurance stipend, six paid holidays, PTO, maternity leave, and discounted dental services for you and your immediate family at our practice
* Over 90% private insurance and Fee For Service patient accounts
Salary:
* $20,000 signing bonus paid within your first 30 days of employment
* Earn 30% of your collections
* $10,000/month guaranteed income for your first 3 months
Job Duties:
* Lead a dental office with the support of Dr. Sieverding and Dr. Miller
* Complete dental exams and diagnose dental conditions
* Formulate treatment plans tailored to each patient's needs
* Carry out agreed clinical treatments
* Assist in the recruitment, training, and management of staff
* Take advantage of our CE reimbursement program and stay up to date with the latest and greatest clinically advanced dental care
Minimum Qualifications:
* Must be a DDS or DMD from an accredited school
* Must have an active dental license in Iowa
Physical Requirements:
* Ability to perform essential duties as deemed necessary with or without reasonable accommodation. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential duties of the position
* Prolonged periods of sitting and standing
* Must be able to lift and carry up to 45 pounds at times
Diversity and inclusion are some of our core values. Protections of federal, state and local laws affording equal opportunity are provided for our employees and applicants for employment.
About Cottage Grove Dental Care:
Cottage Grove Dental Care, previously known as Miller Dental, has existed for over 30 years. Dr. Connie Miller is our founder, who built a successful practice on doing the right thing for the right reasons, and in turn has created generations of loyal patients. In 2022, Dr. Matthew Sieverding purchased and joined the practice and it was re-named Cottage Grove Dental Care. The practice is currently undergoing a build-out to add more operatories so that we can accommodate our growing number of patients. This also means we will need a bigger team. Our vision is to continue to grow and create outstanding careers for dentists and dental team members. Currently we have three assistants, two hygienists, two front office staff and two dentists. You can expect support from our experienced dental staff every step of the way. We care for all age groups from pediatric to geriatric.
About Marion:
Cedar Rapids is ranked amongst the lowest cost of living cities in the United States. It is named as Iowa's best city for young families to live and grow; it has a top ranking for one of the safest cities in America. Marion and Cedar Rapids’ excellent school districts, affordable housing and convenient location offer an ideal opportunity for families and new dentists alike. Uptown Marion, Wanatee Park, apple orchards, arts and cultural attractions make Marion and Cottage Grove Dental Care a prime office location.

The Oregon Tech Dental Clinic is seeking candidates for a Clinical or Faculty Dentist. Whether you are in your early career and looking to expand your potential, or, are at the end of your career and want to slow down a bit; this position can be customized to fit. This is a flexible position that can provide a range of services based on the chosen candidateâs interests. This position offers a variety of opportunities between clinical care and academia.

Option 1: Part-time faculty Dentist (.50-.75 FTE position)
As a part-time faculty member supporting the dental hygiene program and students during patient care; reviewing radiographs with students and providing patient referrals; performing limited exams for patients in the DH clinic; working with faculty on department objectives and community outreach; helping to facilitate supply management and insurance claims.

Option 2: Full-time Clinical Dentist (12 month Non-tenure faculty position)
As a full-time dentist in the Oregon Tech Dental Clinic, you will provide general dentistry services to community and campus patients, serve as the Dental Director for the auxiliary dental clinic business, collaborate with clinical partners and CCOâs and area on-call services, supervise clinical support staff, and work to help integrate enrichment opportunities for Oregon Tech students in our program. Other potential opportunities may include community outreach events, didactic teaching, and curriculum involvement as we expand our offerings in the areas of dental sciences in southern Oregon.

As a public university, Oregon Tech offers an engaging, fun and flexible work environment with a generous benefits package including Core Benefits of Medical, Dental, Vision, and Basic Life Insurance, participation in retirement benefits and a wide variety of optional benefits (https://www.oit.edu/human-resources/benefits). The successful candidate may be eligible for student loan forgiveness through opportunities like PSLF, HRSA, Oregon Office of Rural Health, and other government sponsored programs for dental providers. Salary will be adjusted for either part time or full-time employment and the type of activities agreed upon in the job description.

Oregon Tech is in sunny Klamath Falls, Oregon, a close-knit community with small town charm. In the high desert of southern Oregon, Klamath has four seasons of beauty, and is within an hourâs drive of Medford, OR with extensive shopping and entertainment opportunities. The area offers a bounty of outdoor recreation like Crater Lake National Park, the Pacific Crest Trail, and the Lava Beds National Monument, as well as numerous mountain lakes and hiking trails nearby.

Departmental Information: 

The Dental Hygiene Department provides a collaborative learning environment in state-of-the-art facilities, utilizing digital media for radiographs and clinical technologies and 100% electronic health records. The department has created a unique collaboration between an academic allied health program, and a full-service dental clinic auxiliary that serves the needs of the Klamath Basin and provides enrichment opportunities for dental hygiene students. The employed dentist has a combination role as a faculty member and a dental provider.

The Dental Hygiene program is renowned for our robust community outreach courses, international travel to third world countries to provide dental care and for our exceptionally prepared graduates. Oregon Tech offers excellent mentorship opportunities for both new and experienced faculty through Excellence in Teaching sponsored by Oregon Techâs Commission on College Teaching (CCT). The Dental Hygiene program embraces opportunities for inter-professional collaboration between disciplines. The Dental Hygiene department is a great example of the university motto in action, âHands on education for real world achievement.â
Qualification Requirements:
â¢	Current Oregon State Dental License or receive one within 90 days of employment
â¢	Current CPR/BLS as required by state licensure
â¢	Possess ability to perform all duties and rights as mandated for a dentist by the Oregon Dental Practice Act
â¢	Possess or be eligible to obtain a valid DEA number, and personal malpractice insurance


Preferred Qualifications: 
â¢	Prior experience working in higher education or in a dental/dental hygiene program
â¢	Prior experience in business management or entrepreneurship/marketing
â¢	Experience with managed care and diverse populations
â¢	Hold an Oregon Class 1 permit for conscious sedation
â¢	Bilingual in English and Spanish

Special Instructions to Applicant:
Applications will continue to be accepted post the initial review date. The initial review of applications will begin on November 13, 2023. Applications will continue to be accepted after the initial review date until a sufficient applicant pool has been achieved or the position is filled. Therefore, at the discretion of the University, materials received after the initial review date may not receive full consideration.

To apply, visit: https://jobs.oit.edu/postings/6105

Then, submit an application and upload the following elements:

Required Elements
1.	Resume
2.	Professional References List
3.	License/Certification
4.	Other Document

Optional Elements
1.	Letter of Recommendation
2.	Curriculum Vitae
3.	Teaching Philosophy

Oregon Tech is an Affirmative Action/Equal Opportunity Educator and Employer. The University does not discriminate in access to its educational programs and activities, or with respect to hiring, or the terms and conditions of employment, on the basis of age, color, disability, marital status, national origin, race, religion or creed, sex or gender, gender identity or gender expression, sexual orientation, veteran status, or any other basis in law.

Oregon Tech is committed to providing access and reasonable accommodation in its services, programs, activities, education and employment for individuals with disabilities. To request disability accommodation in the application process, contact the Office of Human Resources.

Exploring a Rewarding Career Shift in Dentistry? Your Next Chapter Starts Here!

Are you a recent dental graduate or soon-to-be one, looking to embark on an exciting career journey? Perhaps you have had an associateship experience that did not align with your expectations, and you are eager for a fresh start. Look no further â your opportunity for professional growth and fulfillment awaits.

About Us
Michel Dental has proudly served Silver Lake and the Topeka area for over 42 years, establishing a reputation for delivering top-tier dental services. Our core philosophy revolves around empowering patients to be active participants in their treatment plans, ensuring they make informed decisions that align with their individual needs. We offer a comprehensive range of dental services encompassing preventive, restorative, and cosmetic dentistry, catering to patients of all ages. The moment patients step through our doors, they experience our welcoming environment and compassionate team, instantly putting them at ease.
Our practice is built upon a set of core values that define our identity and guide our approach:
â¢	Honesty: We uphold integrity and accountability, always doing what is right for the right reasons.
â¢	Caring: Patient comfort and well-being are at the heart of our practice, and we listen attentively to their desires.
â¢	Teamwork: Every team member plays a crucial role in our collective efforts to provide the best possible patient care.
â¢	Excellence: Continuous improvement is our mantra, ensuring quality results and service.
â¢	Welcoming: Our doors are open to all, welcoming everyone with warmth and a friendly smile.
â¢	Relationships: We prioritize authentic, enduring relationships with both colleagues and patients, which form the foundation of our practice.
We invite you to join our team and embrace these values that resonate deeply with our current members.

A Day in the Life of an Associate Dentist at Michel Dental

As an associate dentist at Michel Dental, your typical day will include:
- Interactive Morning Huddle: We kick off our day at 7:15 am with an engaging morning huddle, where youand#39;ll collaborate with our dedicated team to reflect on past successes, address areas for improvement, and prepare for that days patients.

- Collaborative Environment: You will work alongside 23 dental and business professionals, including fellow dentists, hygienists, and support staff, fostering an environment of mutual support and growth.
- Caring for Diverse Patients: At Michel Dental, you will have the opportunity to contribute to the oral health of patients from various backgrounds, ages, and walks of life.
- Cutting-Edge Setup: We operate in a modern, paperless, high-tech office powered by Dentrix software and equipped with advanced tools and equipment.
- Individualized Approach: You will treat each patient as a valued member of our dental family, ensuring that their care is tailored to their unique needs and preferences.
- Varied Case Load: You will attend to a diverse range of patients, ranging from 20 to 80 patients daily, offering comprehensive services such as endodontics, tooth replacement, and Invisalign.

You are the Perfect Fit If...
If you are considering joining our team, you are the perfect fit if:
- You thrive in a fast-paced environment, working closely with professionals dedicated to providing outstanding patient care.
- The opportunity to improve lives through your work gives you immense satisfaction.
- You enjoy a diverse patient mix, spanning preventative, restorative, and cosmetic care.
- You understand that building a strong patient-provider relationship takes time, and you are committed to fostering trust before treatment acceptance.
- You are dedicated to continuous professional growth, eagerly sharing your aspirations with our team.
- You exude enthusiasm and positive energy, spreading it to both colleagues and patients.
- Healthy competition motivates you to deliver top-notch dental care.
- You are self-motivated, initiating process improvements to enhance Michel Dentals overall performance.
- You are comfortable admitting when you are uncertain, showcasing confidence and humility in equal measure.
- Building lasting relationships with both patients and colleagues brings you joy.
- Clear and effective communication, in various forms, is one of your strong suits, which is crucial for success at Michel Dental.

If You are Not...
If you are resistant to change, prefer a solo approach over teamwork, seeking a short-term job, or not willing to prioritize practice and patient needs, this opportunity might not align with your goals.

Ready to Join Us?
If our vision resonates with you and you believe this opportunity is the perfect fit for your career aspirations, we invite you to connect with us. Michel Dental welcomes you to embark on a rewarding adventure, embracing excellence alongside a vibrant team of professionals. Your next chapter in dentistry starts here!

description:
A full-time position is available at Lourdes Dental Care, a state-of-the-art dental facility, which also operates 2 Mobile Dental Clinic, offering community hygiene support, dental services and school-based dental services. In response to a long-standing community need for dental services, Lourdes has established the Dental Care Practice located at 219 Front Street in Binghamton, NY, focusing on restoring and supporting dental health
for adults and children. The services provided through Lourdes Dental Care include: - urgent care -routine cleanings -fillings - crowns -simple extractions -sealants -x-rays - fluoride treatments -patient education. Services are provided by 2 General Dentists, one 1 Pediatric Dentist (serving patients 0-13 years of age) and 5 Registered Dental Hygienists. Lourdes Dental Care services both adults and children who are uninsured, receiving
Medicaid and children enrolled in New York State's Child Health Plus program. Lourdes Dental Care prides itself on serving a Broome County population that is underserved for dental services in the Upstate New York Community and offers services to self-pay patients, using a sliding fee scale.
Package
Lourdes offers a competitive salary and full benefits which includes generous PTO of 35 days, CME, sign-on bonus, and relocation reimbursement. Additionally, the site is a certified NHSC site and dentists meeting eligibility guidelines are encouraged to apply for the NHSC student loan forgiveness program.
Facility
Lourdes Dental Care is affiliated with Lourdes Hospital, a not-for-profit, 162-bed, full- service community hospital with 18 primary care network practices. Lourdes Hospital has served the city of Binghamton and surrounding communities since 1925. The hospital has over 450 independent specialists and primary care physicians on its medical staff and is part of Ascension Health, the largest Catholic not-for-profit health care system in the country. The quality of care provided by Lourdes has been recognized nationally through accreditations and designations for years. Lourdes opened the region's first comprehensive Cancer Care Center and has the distinction of
being named a Designated Stroke Center by the State of New York. The Binghamton area boasts great diversity in culture, religion and lifestyles, and is the home of highly regarded Binghamton University. The community's cost of living is 10% below the national average, and the area's public and parochial schools are nationally recognized for excellence. Recreation and leisure activities are plentiful in this four-season climate, and include minor league ice hockey and baseball, a symphony orchestra, an opera company and proximity to New York State wineries, lakes, parks and trails.
Equal Employment Opportunity
As an equal opportunity employer, Our Lady of Lourdes Memorial Hospital (Lourdes) follows all applicable employment laws and regulations. To provide equal employment opportunities to all individuals, employment decisions at Lourdes are based on merit, qualifications and abilities. Lourdes does not discriminate based on race, color, religion, gender, disability, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, national origin, age, genetic information,
marital status, amnesty, any other legally protected status or status as a covered veteran in accordance with applicable federal, state and local laws.
Lourdes is an EEO/AA employer: M/F/Disabled/Vet. Salary Range Offered, depending on experience, is $175,000 to $190,000.

description:
Dental Director  
General Summary:
Oversee and evaluate Dental services provided by Hope Health. Ensure the implementation of current clinical best practices in the management of Center patients in accordance with Bureau of Primary Health Care (BPHC), HRSA guidelines and standards.  Oversee the dental management activities, including provider recruitment, development and retention, established and achievement of provider productivity benchmarks, clinical quality improvement, utilization management and/or peer review, and risk management to ensure quality, cost-effective care for specific populations.  Develop, implement, evaluate, and revise the Centerâs Dental Performance Measures in accordance with BPHC HRSA standards.  Protect the dignity, privacy, and confidentiality of patients and their families, as well as co-workers and others.

DUTIES andamp; RESPONSIBILITIES
â¢Retain, supervise, mentor, and evaluate provider and dental staff.
â¢Orientate new dental providers and assess their skills and expertise to manage and treat patients and to perform medical procedures consistent with Center policy and procedure in accordance with BPHC HRSA guidelines.
â¢Oversee and assure adequacy of dental staffing through management of an equitable schedule time off.
â¢Approve or deny requests from dental staff to attend various medical education conferences.
â¢Serve as the member of the Clinical Quality Assurance/Performance Improvement (QA/PI) Committee and assure the implementation of a clinical quality improvement program, including chart reviews, revising monitors, and making recommendations to the QA/PI Committee, CEO, and the Board of Directors regarding quality improvement.
â¢Shall actively participate in the Centerâs peer review process, which includes chart reviews and reporting on the findings, outcomes, and progress.
â¢Assure the development, implementation, and evaluation of the Centerâs annual Health Plan (Clinical Performance Measures).  Prepare an annual report of outcomes and proposed revisions for the Boardâs approval.
â¢Shall participate in the annual review of the Clinical/Dental Policies and Procedures Manual, and finalize approval.
â¢Develop and implement written dental policies, procedures, protocols, and standards of care based on current clinical best practices and community norms.
â¢Shall effectively assist the dental staff in the development and training of educational programs for staff and patients.
â¢Assure provider staff compliance with applicable dental and Center policies and procedures.
â¢Work with the CEO, the Leadership Team, and Board of Directors to achieve the Centerâs mission.

description:
Why Choose TODAY DENTAL? We are a family-owned and operated business with an exceptional team. Our core values shape our approach, aiming to create a drama-free, enjoyable, motivating, well-trained, and productive atmosphere. We aspire for our Today Dental Family to feel inspired to excel in their passion. Our dentists have full autonomy, and we provide support when needed to make the best decisions for our patients. Unlike other companies, each office has only one dentist, fostering a non-competitive environment focused on productivity. We have a wonderful team of dentists spanning from New Grad to 30 years. We go beyond being just dentists and a dental company; we actively give back to the community, spend time with children at the Scottish Rite Hospital, and undertake charity cases to remain humble and grounded. Our team enjoys company outings, allowing owners, doctors, and staff to connect outside of the office. Ultimately, as a family, our goal is to find exceptional doctors who genuinely love the company they are a part of and are committed for the long term.

Salary Potential 
$170,000-300,000 per year.

What Our Practice Offers:
*Comprehensive training enabling general dentists to perform various procedures, including molar endo, surgical extractions, Invisalign, and 
   implant dentistry.
*Mentorship from owners and colleagues within the company.
*State-of-the-art equipment, such as iTero scanners, fully digital practices, etc. 
*PPO and fee-for-service patients with high reimbursement rates, maximizing income potential.
*Complete clinical autonomy and effective marketing strategies, resulting in a substantial influx of new patients each month (60-120); new 
  patients).
*No HMO

What We Offer:
*Competitive compensation structure
*Company pays lab expenses.
*Personalized one-on-one training and mentorship.
*Medical insurance.
*Dental and Ortho benefits for employees and their families
*Vision coverage.
*Life insurance.

Responsibilities:
*Building and nurturing long-term relationships with guests and the team.
*Providing a wide range of general and cosmetic dentistry services to mostly fee-for-service and PPO patients, including crowns, bridges, molar 
  endo, and Invisalign.
*Committing to ongoing clinical learning and education in collaboration with a group of doctors.
*Delivering high-quality care while adhering to the highest standards of dental practice ethics and professionalism.

Qualifications:
*DDS/DMD degree
*We welcome new graduates 
*Active or pending state dental board license.
*Caring, patient focused, patient centered, leadership

At TODAY DENTAL, Culture is Everything! Visit our Website (TodayDental.com), as well as our Today Dental Instagram and TikTok pages to learn more about us.

-Pedo (see above note on pedo)

We are looking for a Smile Maker who is meticulous and skilled. Our team is growing, and weand#39;re looking for a Dentist to join us!
About us:
In Fort Worth, Texas, Smile Ninja Dental andamp; Orthodontics is a general dental practice that prioritizes caring for families and young patients beginning at age 6 months old. Honest and empathetic dentistry is what we practice. Our daily interactions with our patients and their families are enjoyable, and we take pride in the relationships we have built with them. These principles motivate us to fulfill our goal of offering high-quality dental care in a fun setting. The environment we have established and the connections we have made set us apart from other offices. We provide a great deal more than conventional dentistry. Our patients and team alike are motivated by this experience.
About you:
Weand#39;re looking for a dentist with a great people skills, a gentle chairside manner, and empathy and compassion for both kids and parents. A dentist with two years experience is what we prefer. 
What we offer:
To support our doctors, we offer a $10k sign on bonus and $800 for the first 30 days of employment for a full day and 30% adjusted production.  With the potential of over $300K annually, depending on the number of days worked.
The qualifications include a dental degree (DDS, DMD), an active Texas State Dental Board license, a commitment to quality, a love of preventive dentistry, and a passion for patient care.
In addition to having a thriving economy and a number of top-notch public, private, and charter schools for kids, Fort Worth, Texas, is in the heart of the DFW metropolitan area.  Downtown Fort Worth is approximately a 15 minutes drive, a 30 minute drive to DFW Airport, and a 40 minute drive to Dallas, TX.
If youand#39;re motivated by the effective delivery of high-quality dental care we think youand#39;ll fit in just fine. This is an excellent opportunity for mentorship to learn for those also interested in orthodontics, pediatric dentistry, or 3rd molar extraction.

Weand#39;re looking for a dentist with a great people skills, a gentle chairside manner, and empathy and compassion for both kids and parents. A dentist with two years experience is what we prefer.

description:
Why Choose TODAY DENTAL? We are a family-owned and operated business with an exceptional team. Our core values shape our approach, aiming to create a drama-free, enjoyable, motivating, well-trained, and productive atmosphere. We aspire for our Today Dental Family to feel inspired to excel in their passion. Our dentists have full autonomy, and we provide support when needed to make the best decisions for our patients. Unlike other companies, each office has only one dentist, fostering a non-competitive environment focused on productivity. We have a wonderful team of dentists spanning from New Grad to 30 years. We go beyond being just dentists and a dental company; we actively give back to the community, spend time with children at the Scottish Rite Hospital, and undertake charity cases to remain humble and grounded. Our team enjoys company outings, allowing owners, doctors, and staff to connect outside of the office. Ultimately, as a family, our goal is to find exceptional doctors who genuinely love the company they are a part of and are committed for the long term.

Salary Potential 
$170,000-300,000 per year.

What Our Practice Offers:
*Comprehensive training enabling general dentists to perform various procedures, including molar endo, surgical extractions, Invisalign, and 
   implant dentistry.
*Mentorship from owners and colleagues within the company.
*State-of-the-art equipment, such as iTero scanners, fully digital practices, etc. 
*PPO and fee-for-service patients with high reimbursement rates, maximizing income potential.
*Complete clinical autonomy and effective marketing strategies, resulting in a substantial influx of new patients each month (60-120); new 
  patients).
*No HMO

What We Offer:
*Competitive compensation structure
*Company pays lab expenses.
*Personalized one-on-one training and mentorship.
*Medical insurance.
*Dental and Ortho benefits for employees and their families
*Vision coverage.
*Life insurance.

Responsibilities:
*Building and nurturing long-term relationships with guests and the team.
*Providing a wide range of general and cosmetic dentistry services to mostly fee-for-service and PPO patients, including crowns, bridges, molar 
  endo, and Invisalign.
*Committing to ongoing clinical learning and education in collaboration with a group of doctors.
*Delivering high-quality care while adhering to the highest standards of dental practice ethics and professionalism.

Qualifications:
*DDS/DMD degree
*We welcome new graduates 
*Active or pending state dental board license.
*Caring, patient focused, patient centered, leadership

At TODAY DENTAL, Culture is Everything! Visit our Website (TodayDental.com), as well as our Today Dental Instagram and TikTok pages to learn more about us.

description:
We are open to part-time or full-time position. Our office is open M-F 8am-5pm. 

Â https://goo.gl/maps/yQvukhuArWDgU2rQ6 

Â https://www.lacanteradental.com/

We are looking for a hard working, friendly, ethical general dentist/specialist for our dental office located inside a high end mall in North West San Antonio (the Shops of La Cantera). It is a privately owned office.

We understand both the clinical andamp; business aspects of practicing dentistry and are aware of the hurdles dentists go through while practicing dentistry chair-side. As a dentist, you will get the support and guidance needed to provide top notch dental care for your patients. Doctors have full autonomy when it comes to providing care for their patients. This makes them feel like they are working in their own practice minus the headaches of running the business aspects of managing a dental office. Our doctors look for a career not a job.

Office is state-of-the-art facility with a great patient pool with a variety of dental services -- Crowns, Bridges, Veneers, Dentures, Implants, All-on-X, Root Canals, Fillings, Periodontics, Sedation (Nitrous, Oral, IV and General Anesthesia).

We see adults as well as some kids. We also see special-needs patients and patients that require higher levels of sedation for treatment.

Great earning potential for candidates who are clinically savvy and dedicated to work hard.

We are looking for a doctor - - who loves creating long lasting relationships with patients - who is not afraid to work as a solo practitioner - who enjoys practicing dentistry andamp; understands the importance of teamwork - who has a strong sense of ethics, integrity and humility

Compensation andamp; Benefits:
- Higher of monthly minimum or % adjusted production
- Health/Vision
- Free internal CE courses
- Salary: $225,000 - $450,000.00 per year

POSITION SUMMARY
We are currently seeking a compassionate, highly motived dentist to join a team of highly skilled clinicians caring for special needs individuals at the Happy Ohana Smiles dental clinic. As one of several dentists, you will provide oral care for special needs patients of all ages. You will work in cooperation with our administrative and clinical team to examine, evaluate and implement treatment plans for our special patients. Some of the services you will perform and oversee include state-of-the-art digital imaging, head-neck and oral cancer screenings, dental cleanings, exams, x-rays, fillings, extractions, dentures and oral appliances. Sedation training and state/federal credentials are highly encouraged.

LOCATION
Morganâs Multi-Assistance Center (MAC) is located in San Antonio, Texas and is part of Morganâs Inclusive Initiative. The MAC is a unique and innovative endeavor dedicated to utilizing a comprehensive navigation service model to provide medical and non-medical services for individuals with disabilities and special needs of all ages. This service is referred to as Morganâs MAC Care Modelâ¢ and is centered around addressing Non-Medical Drivers of Health (NMDOH) through team members known as MAC Navigators that serve as single points of contact for MAC members.

Happy Ohana Smiles, the dental specialty portion of the MAC is a state-of-the-art, ultra-accessible dental clinic that keeps the care of the special needs individual front and center. The layout is designed for comfortable access for all, has calming areas to ease anxiety and provides comforting sights, sounds and smells to relax the patient and family members. The clinic uses specialized equipment in the treatment rooms to accommodate both walking and wheelchair patients, and our staff is trained and experienced in special needs communication and care. Our clinic is currently approved for various Medicaid and Medicare Waiver programs, but also serves major insurance plans and self-pay options.

description:
Are you an experienced general dentist looking for a great opportunity in metro Atlanta? Our rapidly growing private group practice in Brookhaven GA, might be the perfect fit for you! We value our team and believe in investing in their success. Join us to explore the future of partnership opportunities and a culture of patient-centric care and comprehensive, integrated care.

Here are some of the benefits of joining our team:

- Our patient base is well-established and growing, with a focus on adults.
- Our payer mix includes cash and PPO.
- We have state-of-the-art equipment, including Itero scanners, CBCT, and digital imaging.
- You will have clinical autonomy and be expected to be proficient in endo, cosmetics, implant placement and restoration, crown and bridge, and Invisalign.
- Our well-trained, seasoned team is dedicated to delivering a superior patient experience.
- Compensation is based on a daily guarantee and/or adjusted production.
- You will receive paid vacation and holidays, as well as liability insurance coverage and medical insurance.
- We require a DMD or DDS degree and a Georgia state license.

We encourage you to apply if you are looking for a great opportunity to grow your career while providing excellent patient care.

We are a fee for service, private practice seeking an Associate Dentist who prioritizes incredible patient care and patient experience and who is looking for a fantastic opportunity to grow! 

Location: Summerville, GA, which is located in NW Georgia and is a beautiful area! Summerville is convenient to Rome, Calhoun, Dalton, and Chattanooga!

About the practice: We have a patient base that includes generations of families who have been part of our dental family for decades. The practice is fee for service, and we have a healthy flow of new patients joining us. We have talented and experienced hygienists, dental assistants, and front office team members, many of whom have been with the practice for many years, and we strive to remain on the forefront of technology. We currently utilize cloud based practice management software, digital impressions, digital x-rays with new sensors, intraoral cameras, and Cerec, to name a few. 

As a private practice with deep ties to our community, we embody the values that align with providing the best care possible to patients who are treated like family, by a team who operates like family. We have a great structure for mentorship, lead by a doctor who values investing in every member of our organization to support growth, obtaining goals, and long term career fulfillment. 

We have an extremely competitive compensation and benefits package that we would love to discuss with you! To highlight a couple of details, we offer a competitive percentage of collections as a pay structure and a great daily guarantee to get you established, as well as continuing education benefits. Right now, weand#39;re also offering a fantastic sign on bonus! Our team is dedicated to building your practice within the practice, as well as transferring the goodwill with the patients who are already established and know us well. In other words, we are committed to your success! Weand#39;d love the opportunity to further to discuss the position, the office/team, and the comp and benefits in their entirety with you, and most importantly, we would love to get to know you! Our team is so excited to be growing again, and we are ready to welcome in our next incredible provider!

Dental Director  General Summary:
Oversee and evaluate Dental services provided by Hope Health. Ensure the implementation of current clinical best practices in the management of Center patients in accordance with Bureau of Primary Health Care (BPHC), HRSA guidelines and standards.  Oversee the dental management activities, including provider recruitment, development and retention, established and achievement of provider productivity benchmarks, clinical quality improvement, utilization management and/or peer review, and risk management to ensure quality, cost-effective care for specific populations.  Develop, implement, evaluate, and revise the Centerâs Dental Performance Measures in accordance with BPHC HRSA standards.  Protect the dignity, privacy, and confidentiality of patients and their families, as well as co-workers and others.

DUTIES andamp; RESPONSIBILITIES
â¢Retain, supervise, mentor, and evaluate provider and dental staff.
â¢Orientate new dental providers and assess their skills and expertise to manage and treat patients and to perform medical procedures consistent with Center policy and procedure in accordance with BPHC HRSA guidelines.
â¢Oversee and assure adequacy of dental staffing through management of an equitable schedule time off.
â¢Approve or deny requests from dental staff to attend various medical education conferences.
â¢Serve as the member of the Clinical Quality Assurance/Performance Improvement (QA/PI) Committee and assure the implementation of a clinical quality improvement program, including chart reviews, revising monitors, and making recommendations to the QA/PI Committee, CEO, and the Board of Directors regarding quality improvement.
â¢Shall actively participate in the Centerâs peer review process, which includes chart reviews and reporting on the findings, outcomes, and progress.
â¢Assure the development, implementation, and evaluation of the Centerâs annual Health Plan (Clinical Performance Measures).  Prepare an annual report of outcomes and proposed revisions for the Boardâs approval.
â¢Shall participate in the annual review of the Clinical/Dental Policies and Procedures Manual, and finalize approval.
â¢Develop and implement written dental policies, procedures, protocols, and standards of care based on current clinical best practices and community norms.
â¢Shall effectively assist the dental staff in the development and training of educational programs for staff and patients.
â¢Assure provider staff compliance with applicable dental and Center policies and procedures.
â¢Work with the CEO, the Leadership Team, and Board of Directors to achieve the Centerâs mission.

description:
Well-established Florida Panhandle office looking to hire associate dentist. 10 operatory practice with modern technology. Gross collections in 2022 of $2,180,000 with growth expected in 2023. Averaging 60 new patients a month. Experienced clinical and administration team. Associate will not be responsible for lab fees, malpractice insurance, license renewals, or continuing education costs. No nights, no weekends, no more than 200 working days a year. A list of benefits is featured below as well as more information about the practice and city. 

ABOUT PERSONAL ATTENTION DENTAL CENTER
Personal Attention Dental Center opened its doors on August 24, 1984 by UAB alumni Dr. David Pete Windham. Over the last 39 years, PADC has grown from a one operatory rental space to a ten operatory free-standing building. In 2017, Dr. William Windham (UAB alumni) joined his father in practice and is working hard to continue the legacy his father has built. We specialize in personal attention just like our name indicates. We strive for excellence in customer service and patient care while putting emphasis on long-term patient health. We have a unique, efficient environment that maximizes production. For the last 21 years, we have consistently collected $1,800,000and#43; annually with our current 2023 projections being $2,200,000. 

ABOUT PANAMA CITY
Panama City, Florida is filled with life. From our white sugar sand beaches and emerald green water, state parks, and any outdoor activity you could imagine to dining, shopping, and entertainment - Panama City is the definition of work hard, play hard. Nestled in the Florida Panhandle, Panama City provides the convenience of being less than six hours away from Orlando, Atlanta, and New Orleans by car. For further convenience, Northwest Florida Beaches International Airport provides direct flights to many popular destinations. Downtown Panama City resides along St. Andrewand#39;s Bay and features local shops, restaurants, a Saturday farmers market, and several block parties throughout the year. Thereand#39;s something for everyone of every age in beautiful Panama City, Florida! 

CANDIDATE BENEFITS
â¢	Starting salary of $125,000and#43; 
â¢	Cash sign-on bonus 
â¢	Monthly bonus based on total office collections
â¢	401(K)
â¢	Health insurance 
â¢	HSA
â¢	Complimentary in-house dental treatment for doctor and immediate family 
â¢	All expenses covered for the following: license renewals, malpractice insurance, lab fees, continuing education, personalized scrub tops
â¢	No more than 200 working days a year, 4-day work weeks, 2 paid weeks off for Christmas, no nights, no weekends
â¢	Office hours are Tuesday â Friday 8:00am â 5:00pm 

CANDIDATE REQUIREMENTS
â¢	Current or pending license to practice dentistry in the state of Florida unless a current student â Itâs never been easier to get a Florida license than it is right now!
â¢	General dentist with interest in endo and implant placement

For more than 25 years, weâve established a reputation of professionalism, trust, and high-quality dentistry within our community, which has led to an overflow of 95and#43; new patients each month! Our doctors enjoy a 4-day work week with full autonomy over their patients, and with our highly-skilled team of Restorative II Expanded Functions dental assistants, our doctors can reach higher levels of production while giving our patients a thoughtful, personalized experience during each visit.

As a private practice, we pride ourselves on being a great place to work with fun office culture and a support-staff of handpicked professionals who are positive, knowledgeable experts within their field! description: We are seeking experienced associates to join our state of the are practice, full time or part time. We see patients of all ages and perform all aspects of dentistry.  Come practice dentistry and go home without the headaches!

Walmart Health is looking to hire a Dentist to support our local health center. We offer a competitive package including base salary, sign on/relocation bonus, annual incentive bonus, comprehensive benefit plans, 401(K) with employer match, license renewal fee and continuing education time and reimbursement, and more! See what it’s like to be a part of the Walmart Health family at

[Apply Here]
 rel="noopener">.
Walmart Health strives to be a center of wellbeing in the communities we serve, and we have a unique opportunity to provide access to affordable healthcare to millions of people. We need passionate healthcare professionals to help us achieve our mission. 
You'll make an impact as you:

Diagnose oral diseases and create treatment plans to maintain or restore the oral health of patients in our clinic
Perform dental procedures, such as fillings, extractions, and root canals while ensuring the safe administration of anesthetics and conscious sedation
Work with Dental Hygienists to ensure understanding of state and local compliance measures
Work in electronic health record systems
Cross collaborate with other providers specialized in their fields
Apply thorough understanding of the balance and importance of quality and accessible patient care
Deliver comprehensive integrated care

You'll sweep us off our feet if you have...


At least 3+ years’ experience as practicing dental provider


Minimum Qualifications:

Degree from Accredited School of Dentistry – new graduates welcome to apply!
Current, unrestricted licensed in State where practicing
Is not sanctioned or has adverse action against licenses held in other states within the past 5 years
Valid DEA
Valid CDS if applicable to state
Current BLS, ALS and PAL certification to perform conscious sedation

About Walmart Health
Walmart Health is committed to making health care more affordable and accessible for customers in the communities we serve. Walmart Health was launched to provide affordable, transparent pricing for key health center services for local patients, regardless of insurance status.
 
The patient is at the heart of all we do. Walmart Health employs on-the-ground health providers to be a first-of-its-kind health center to deliver primary and urgent care, labs, x-ray and diagnostics, counseling, dental, and hearing services all in one facility.

Are you energetic, service oriented, love technology and work well with patients and staff members?  Have you been seeking a position that provides an opportunity to truly grow with mentorship and training?  Look no further.  We are a privately owned PPO and FFS practice with a strong reputation for compassionate care and quality dentistry.  

We are located in Tomball TX, 40 minutes North of Houston. Our growing practice is looking for a skilled and caring Part-time or Full-time dentist to join our growing team. 

2-3 years minimum experience and proficiency in fillings, crown and bridge and surgical extractions required.  AEGD and GPR residents are welcome to apply.  Molar endo and pediatric dentistry proficiency preferred but we can train If needed.  We also provide implant dentistry, Invisalign and removable denture treatments to our patients.  You will enjoy support from our strong administrative team that knows case presentation, billing and scheduling.

Our office is a state-of-the art technology and efficiency systems driven office that will allow you to do your best dentistry in a supportive and safe environment.

description:
My name is Dr. Ryan Young, and I am selling my practice so that I can move out west to be closer to family.

I own 50% of the practice with another doctor. Over the last twelve months I have personally collected $600,000. Our overhead ranges between 50-60% every month. Therefore I made a little less than $300,000 over the last twelve months.

The doctors own 100% of the practice. There is no outside ownership from a DSO. Comfort Dental is a franchise, meaning we pay a small fee every month to get the advantages of being part of a larger group (for example, discounted supplies and lab fees, etc.), while still being able to own 100% of the practice ourselves. If you are interested in learning more about Comfort Dental as a franchise, go to https://comfortdental.com/franchise. 

This is a great office with a great staff, and good potential for growth. Every year has been better than the last since Covid, so you can expect to make more than my average in the next twelve months.

The office is well run. We collected 98% of our production over the last year, so there is very little wasted work. You get paid for what you do. We see an average of 60-70 new patients every month. 

I am pricing it lower than its value because I need to move out west to be closer to family for personal reasons as soon as possible. This is a very good deal for a partnership buy-in. If you are worried about procuring the funds for a buy-in, we do have a bank we work with that we can direct you to, if needed.

The other doctor at the practice, Dr. McCormick, has been practicing for almost 20 years. He is a great partner. He loves to mentor and will be a huge resource for any dentist wanting to get better and faster at dentistry.

The easiest way to get a hold of me is to just call or text me at [sign in to DentalPost to see current contact info] Or you can respond to this ad if you want me to contact you.

description:
Huntsville Hospital is bolstering their OMS service line due to growth. We are currently recruiting additional OMS surgeons due to local retirements and increased demand. Join a turn-key practice with immediate ramp-up. 


Newly built, 10,000 sq/ft office
Blocked surgical schedule, 3+ days/week
ENTs, Trauma Surgeons, and Plastic Surgery on-staff
Guaranteed salary, production, and full benefits
$125,000 Sign-on bonus 

Huntsville is ranked one of the most desirable cities in the US for its livability and cost of living and is one of the fastest growing cities in America. It boasts an excellent public school system and entertainment scene, and is perfectly located for trips to Nashville, Lake Martin, North Georgia Mountains, and Atlanta.
For more details, contact:
Kyri [Apply Here]
 ID#: KI-2308-96374

We are looking for a doctor with a warm heart and gentle hands. Our practice is very busy. We do a lot of ortho, endo, surgery and implants. If you are interested in becoming a super generalist, weand#39;ll pay for your CE courses for orthodontics, or implant placement, or both. We are located in Lake County, Illinois, in the heart if an industrial area. We see military families from the nearby Great Lakes Naval Training Center, and medical students from the nearby Chicago Medical School. Demographically, we have a very diverse practice, and every day is interesting.

I own a general office in Clayton, Ga and I am looking for some help. Clayton is a community nestled in the North Georgia mountains with golf courses, Lake Burton, Lake Rabun, and great restaurants.

My staff and I are laid-back and we enjoy what we do. We are fee-for-service and are booked out for several weeks. My current associate is retiring this year to spend time on the lake and with his grandkids.

This is not a situation where I am looking for someone to take on the procedures I donât want to do. I want you to practice how you like, and have a great earning potential. You would not be expected to do implants/endo/etc. I want you to do the procedures you are comfortable with. You will run the office Wed/Thurs 8:00-5:00. Base salary is $120,000 or 30% of production (whichever is higher). Please reach out so we can chat and I can give you more details.

-Dr. Chip Patterson

Why Choose TODAY DENTAL? We are a family-owned and operated business with an exceptional team. Our core values shape our approach, aiming to create a drama-free, enjoyable, motivating, well-trained, and productive atmosphere. We aspire for our Today Dental Family to feel inspired to excel in their passion. Our dentists have full autonomy, and we provide support when needed to make the best decisions for our patients. Unlike other companies, each office has only one dentist, fostering a non-competitive environment focused on productivity. We have a wonderful team of dentists spanning from New Grad to 30 years. We go beyond being just dentists and a dental company; we actively give back to the community, spend time with children at the Scottish Rite Hospital, and undertake charity cases to remain humble and grounded. Our team enjoys company outings, allowing owners, doctors, and staff to connect outside of the office. Ultimately, as a family, our goal is to find exceptional doctors who genuinely love the company they are a part of and are committed for the long term.

Salary Potential 
$170,000-300,000 per year.

What Our Practice Offers:
*Comprehensive training enabling general dentists to perform various procedures, including molar endo, surgical extractions, Invisalign, and 
   implant dentistry.
*Mentorship from owners and colleagues within the company.
*State-of-the-art equipment, such as iTero scanners, fully digital practices, etc. 
*PPO and fee-for-service patients with high reimbursement rates, maximizing income potential.
*Complete clinical autonomy and effective marketing strategies, resulting in a substantial influx of new patients each month (60-120); new 
  patients).
*No HMO

What We Offer:
*Competitive compensation structure
*Company pays lab expenses.
*Personalized one-on-one training and mentorship.
*Medical insurance.
*Dental and Ortho benefits for employees and their families
*Vision coverage.
*Life insurance.

Responsibilities:
*Building and nurturing long-term relationships with guests and the team.
*Providing a wide range of general and cosmetic dentistry services to mostly fee-for-service and PPO patients, including crowns, bridges, molar 
  endo, and Invisalign.
*Committing to ongoing clinical learning and education in collaboration with a group of doctors.
*Delivering high-quality care while adhering to the highest standards of dental practice ethics and professionalism.

Qualifications:
*DDS/DMD degree
*We welcome new graduates 
*Active or pending state dental board license.
*Caring, patient focused, patient centered, leadership

At TODAY DENTAL, Culture is Everything! Visit our Website (TodayDental.com), as well as our Today Dental Instagram and TikTok pages to learn more about us.

description:
Excellent opportunity for an Endodontist to be a part of a well-established 
Endodontic practice in Northern New Jersey (Hackensack )  as a 
full-time OR part-time associate. New Endodontists are busy from day 1 because 
of the established referral base and processes already in place. We are 
currently seeking Endodontists that appreciate the professional, financial and 
administrative benefits of group practice to join our teams. 

Our offices are well designed, spacious, featuring all digital radiography, 
microscopes, and rotary endo. All of the required equipment and disposables are 
supplied by the office. Office management is highly trained and skilled. We 
have an excellent and well established regional referral base with room to grow.

_________________________________________

Requirements:

â¢Examine, diagnose, and treat diseases of nerve, pulp, and other dental tissues 
affecting  vitality of teeth
â¢Diagnose condition and plan treatment.
â¢Ability to interact with patients in a calm and friendly manner
â¢Team player
â¢Courteous with staff and patients

______________________________________________________________________________

About Us

As an office committed to excellence, at Advanced Endodontics Alliance we take 
pride in the fact that we are equipped with instruments and techniques which 
exhibit the latest and greatest endodontic technology available. We strive to 
provide the best possible endodontic care, stay informed of the latest 
techniques and products, provide a safe and environmentally healthy workplace, 
work with our patients regarding their unique concerns, and give back to the 
community.

My name is Jacob, Iand#39;m the director for Arte Dental and have been with the team for over 9 years. Iand#39;m currently looking for a full time associate for our private office in Plano (near Preston and 121). We are a family owned, PRIVATE practice with 12and#43; years of excellent reputation.  The office is loaded with toys; 3D CBCT, lab grade milling machine (can even cut titanium for custom abutments), digital impressions, 3D printer, tissue laser, etc.  

We train associates on the Nobel guided implant placement/restoration system (my associate in McKinney with no prior implant experience has placed over 60 implants in his first 8 months).  This is a great office to be in! You would be working alongside the owner, Dr. William Nguyen.  Heand#39;s looking to scale back his workflow and allow an associate to take over the schedule for the most part.  Heand#39;s typically there Mon-Thursday to mentor and do larger cases.

No nights, no weekends (Mon-Thurs 8-5  and every other Fr 8-2).  Office is capable of producing over 120k/month between two docs.  WIDE range of services offered; everything from pedo to All-on-Fours and everything in-between.  PPO and FFS only!  We also have an amazing hygienist at that office.  And our lead assistant has been with us for nearly a decade.

Iand#39;m looking for a dentist that will treat the office as their own, but also open to being mentored by Dr. Nguyen.  We will allow a lot of freedom on how you work, treatment plan, etc.  Weand#39;re NOT corporate.

An added bonus, I do not require a time constrained contract. I feel like our relationship should be a mutual one. I want you to be happy and WANT to be here, as opposed to having to be here. :)  We care VERY MUCH about quality dentistry. We treatment plan patients like family. And, we warranty most of our work.  Please respond here, or via text or email (see below), to schedule an interview.

The office location is: 8404 Preston Rd, Plano (near Masala Wok and Pei Wei, in a great and busy shopping center).

I do however conduct the initial interview out of my office in McKinney: 4610 Eldorado Pkwy, McKinney.

Lastly, I will be out of town from Oct 1-7th so I will not have access to my office phone or email during that time.

Sincerely,
Jacob King
Director

We are looking for a general dentist to join our office in Matthews, Weddington NC and Marshville NC. Doctor can pick to work part-time or full-time. Office is not production driven but can keep an associate busy with general procedures such as restorative, crowns, bridge, root canal therapy and extractions. Itero and implant system are available if doctor would like to do such procedures. We see anywhere from 40-50 new patients a month. Generous compensation for the right candidate. We look forward to speaking with you.

My name is Jacob, Iand#39;m the director for Arte Dental and have been with the team for over 9 years. Iand#39;m currently looking for a full time associate for our private office in Plano (near Preston and 121). We are a family owned, PRIVATE practice with 12and#43; years of excellent reputation.  The office is loaded with toys; 3D CBCT, lab grade milling machine (can even cut titanium for custom abutments), digital impressions, 3D printer, tissue laser, etc.  

We train associates on the Nobel guided implant placement/restoration system (my associate in McKinney with no prior implant experience has placed over 60 implants in his first 8 months).  This is a great office to be in! You would be working alongside the owner, Dr. William Nguyen.  Heand#39;s looking to scale back his workflow and allow an associate to take over the schedule for the most part.  Heand#39;s typically there Mon-Thursday to mentor and do larger cases.

No nights, no weekends (Mon-Thurs 8-5  and every other Fr 8-2).  Office is capable of producing over 120k/month between two docs.  WIDE range of services offered; everything from pedo to All-on-Fours and everything in-between.  PPO and FFS only!  We also have an amazing hygienist at that office.  And our lead assistant has been with us for nearly a decade.

Iand#39;m looking for a dentist that will treat the office as their own, but also open to being mentored by Dr. Nguyen.  We will allow a lot of freedom on how you work, treatment plan, etc.  Weand#39;re NOT corporate.

An added bonus, I do not require a time constrained contract. I feel like our relationship should be a mutual one. I want you to be happy and WANT to be here, as opposed to having to be here. :)  We care VERY MUCH about quality dentistry. We treatment plan patients like family. And, we warranty most of our work.  Please respond here, or via text or email (see below), to schedule an interview.

The office location is: 8404 Preston Rd, Plano (near Masala Wok and Pei Wei, in a great and busy shopping center).

I do however conduct the initial interview out of my office in McKinney: 4610 Eldorado Pkwy, McKinney.

Lastly, I will be out of town from Oct 1-7th so I will not have access to my office phone or email during that time.

Sincerely,
Jacob King
Director

location: South Sioux City, Nebraska, United States
description:
About the Company
Mortenson Dental Partners is one of the largest groups of employee-owned dental practices in the United States, with over 140 practices across nine states, over 1,800 team members and nearly one million patient visits each year. Unlike most dental support organizations, we are completely employee owned, with absolutely no private equity. Each location feels like a private practice but enjoys the support of a large organization. We empower our team members to think like owners and make the best decisions for their team, patients and practice.
Our values were built on a foundation of love for one another, regardless of race, color, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, religion or other attributes. We are committed to a workplace that fully represents the communities we serve as we live our four core values — caring for everyone, expressing gratitude, sharing abundantly and building relationships.
 
About the Position
We are looking for passionate and dedicated general practice dentists who love creating long-lasting relationships with their patients. As a general dentist with Mortenson Dental Partners, you’ll have clinical autonomy along with a wealth of benefits. These include free internal clinical education classes on a variety of dental specialties, such as clear aligners, dental implants, endodontics and more! As a new provider, you’ll enjoy a period of guaranteed income as you settle into your practice, followed by 30% of net collections. Our general dentists earn an average of $230,000, with some earning over $400,000 — there is really no limit to your earning potential!  You’ll also immediately be an owner in our organization through our employee stock ownership plan and, if you choose, through any direct stock you purchase. You can take pride in joining an organization that prioritizes clinical quality in all decision-making, utilizing the expertise of an esteemed and expansive Clinical Committee. As a dentist, you will get the support, mentoring and guidance needed to provide excellent care for your patients and growth in your career.  And, to help make the transition easier, we’re offering a minimum sign-on bonus of $20,000.
 
Join an amazing community. Located on the Missouri River, South Sioux City is a growing town of nearly 15,000 residents. It offers convenient access to larger metropolitan areas in three states — Nebraska, South Dakota and Iowa. South Sioux has a rich Native American heritage, and is your gateway to two scenic byways that pay homage to America’s history: the Lewis and Clark Scenic Byway and the Outlaw Trail. For the outdoor enthusiast, it is home to numerous city and state parks as well as the 20-mile Al Bengtson Bike Trail. Take your career on a new adventure and call South Sioux City home!
 
Dentists who pursue a career with Summit Dental Health will enjoy the following benefits:

$200,000 guarantee for the first two years of employment
Earnings of 30% of net collections 
A minimum sign-on bonus of $20,000 and a $5,000 relocation allowance if applicable.
A robust internal learning and development program to advance your education on various specialties, including dental implants, clear aligners, endodontics and more.
An additional $5,000 annually for external CE opportunities. 
One-on-one mentorship
Clinical autonomy with non-clinical administrative support.
Immediate inclusion in our Employee Stock Ownership Plan. 
Company-paid malpractice insurance.
Company-paid financial planning assistance.
No emergency call required. 
Flexible schedule. 
Assistance with the H1B immigration sponsorship process.

 
We are an equal opportunity employer and consider all qualified candidates equally.

Enroll in one of its five university campuses! Need some cultural flavor? Visit one of its many museums or the triple threat Indianapolis Zoo — a zoo, aquarium and botanical gardens all in one! Ready to amp things up? The Indianapolis 500 is your ticket to speed! With six interstates crossing through the city and an award-winning airport, the “Crossroads of America” holds a perfect central location on the map, making it easy to travel to other major cities like Chicago and St. Louis. -Great staff, kind-hearted team members who care about the well being of both our patients and our practice.
-We are well respected and very involved in our community.

Associate Dentist Full or Part-time Needed- Excellent Compensation and 401K Benefits!

The culture of Dunwoody Family and Cosmetic Dentistry is and has been one that embraces change and is constantly adapting toward improving the experience for our patients. We are committed to providing exceptional dentistry in a warm, nurturing, and cohesive environment.  We have been a pioneer in technology integration and work with virtually all leading-edge applications.
We offer full services from General Family Restorative Dentistry, Cosmetic dentistry, Sedation Dentistry, Implant dentistry and Invisalign.
We are looking for a special someone, who can make a full commitment and possesses excellent clinical skills combined with a personality that exudes confidence genuine care, and concern for the patientâs desires concerning their oral health. with a gentle approach to communications.
We are looking for someone to help continue to build on our foundation for future growth and development.  Attitude and desire are necessary as well as a burning desire for self-improvement and continued learning.  
Someone who can collaborate and work well with other professionals to exceed patient expectations and render consistent excellent outcomes.
The ideal candidate will have the flexibility with scheduling, to maximize patient convenience for faster growth as well as have sufficient experience in endodontics, surgery, and prosthetics, so patients can be provided comprehensive care 
The most significant benefit for the successful candidate is the opportunity to work in a technologically advanced practice with exceptional support staff and ongoing mentoring by the doctor owners in treatment planning, patient communications, and clinical applications. Opportunities for future Partnerships in the company are available. We are a successful and stable practice with continual growth and improvement and want to find the next generation of providers to take us to the next level.

General Dentist

We are a growing organization supporting dental practices around 8 states, predominantly pediatric, some general, and orthodontic dentistry in Georgia, Florida, Alabama, Texas, Virginia, North Carolina, South Carolina, Pennsylvania, and Mississippi.  

Established in 2015, we started with 3 offices and now weâre up to 55 offices and we have a good growth plan, but we are looking to grow the right way. We are striving to change the DSO landscape and be different than many DSOs out there. We pride ourselves on our mission statement and core values which govern our practice model. We are very culture driven and are looking for providers who fit our cultural model. We are a dental family. We call our patients, ?guest, and support an exceptional clinical care.  We are looking for a dedicated and motivated provider to join our team who are comfortable treating both children and young adults.

What do we offer?
â¢ Autonomy to practice dentistry the way you were trained in an environment you are comfortable in.
â¢ Competitive compensation and great benefit package.
â¢ Company-paid malpractice insurance.
â¢ Vacation
â¢ Financial support for continuing education.

Next Steps:
We would love to schedule time with you to discuss opportunities, offer a tour of our offices or just to find out more about what you are looking for as you begin/continue your dental career. We look forward to hearing from you!

Responsibilities
â¢ Promote oral health and disease prevention
â¢ Diagnose oral diseases
â¢ Educate patients on oral health and various treatment options
â¢ Create treatment plans to maintain or restore patientâs oral health.
â¢ Review treatment plan options with patients.
â¢ Review, maintain and update patientsâ medical and dental records.
â¢ Review and interpret x-rays and diagnostic tests.
â¢ Monitor growth and development of the teeth and jaws.
â¢ Provide proper restorative and preventive dental care.
â¢ Perform surgical procedures on the teeth, bone and soft tissues of the oral cavity.
â¢ Maintain the highest quality standard of care for all patients.
â¢ Maintain the highest standard of ethics and professionalism within the dental office.
â¢ Keep abreast of new developments, technologies, best practices and standard of care through current continuing education courses and professional development.

Qualifications
â¢ DMD or DDS degree from a university-based dental education program accredited by the American Dental Association Commission on Dental Accreditation (ADA CODA).
â¢ Current state license to practice dentistry.
â¢ Documentation of Hepatitis B vaccination.
â¢ Proof of malpractice insurance.
â¢ Current Basic Life Support (BLS) or cardiopulmonary resuscitation (CPR) certification.

Are you a talented and motivated Associate Dentist looking for an incredible opportunity to shine in a cutting-edge dental practice? Look no further! Our state-of-the-art dental office in the heart of Virginia Beach, VA, is seeking a passionate and skilled Associate Dentist to join our dynamic team.

Proficient in a wide range of dental procedures, ensuring comprehensive treatment for our patients.
Strong communication skills to build rapport with patients and work collaboratively with our team.
Passion for staying updated on the latest trends and techniques in the dental field.
Dedication to maintaining a safe and welcoming environment for both patients and colleagues.

**Perks and Benefits:**
Competitive compensation package with performance-based incentives.
Continuing education support to help you stay ahead in your profession.
Modern and inviting work environment that promotes both patient and team comfort.
Opportunities for professional advancement within our growing practice.
Access to the stunning beaches and amenities of Virginia Beach during your leisure time.

*Join us in shaping smiles and transforming lives!*

Do not miss out on this incredible opportunity to be part of our remarkable dental family in Virginia Beach. We can not wait to welcome you aboard!

â¢	Build your practice from an existing, busy patient base
â¢	You will have diagnostic and treatment autonomy 
â¢	Patients NEVER cherry-picked by a senior dentist or owner
â¢	Very high collection versus production
â¢	First-year general dentist average compensation is $297,000 
â¢	After 3 years at Bear Creek, some of our general dentists earn more than $400,000 a year!

Because of our strong clinical and customer service reputation, we are the dental practice of choice in the communities we serve.
